page.title: 05VILLAGE EDUCATION
page.content: Aston Somerville school, educating children from 5 to 14 years, closed in 1969. Childswickham school closed in 1980, both closures caused by falling rolls. The children now travel to schools in other villages. The 5-10 age group go to First Schools, Childswickham children to Broadway, Aston Somerville children to Sedgeberrow. The 10-13 age group go to Bredon Hill Middle School in Ashton under Hill, moving on to Prince Henry's High School in Evesham at 13 and leaving at either 16 or 18 years old. Some children from the villages attend the Roman Catholic School in Broadway others go to Private Schools in the area. Children attending state schools are provided with free transport as they live 3 miles from the schools.
